text: chili-rubbed flank steak with tomatillo
pineapple salsa this is the grilling
equivalent of a one pot meal and a
perfect recipe for that summer family
gathering I'm gonna start with the
pineapple because that's gonna take the
longest to grill start out putting them
far away from you and then work your way
in now I've got my tomatillos and all I
did was take the husk off jalapenos I
sliced them in half and then I just
scooped out the seeds that's optional if
you want to leave the seeds in garlic
has been halved across its equator this
keeps it together so that the little
garlic's don't fall off and then fall
through the grill that I'm gonna have an
onion that I peeled and then have from
root to stem and this just helps keep it
together on the grill
then everything just gets thrown into
the bowl with the tomatillos and I'm
gonna coat it with a little bit of olive
oil and some salt and pepper and now
when I set up the grill I left one area
bare there's no charcoal right in the
front of this grill that's because I
want to cook the garlic over indirect
heat I'm just gonna put them right there
if I put the garlic over direct heat it
would burn so just like that everything
else just goes in the center of the
grill right over the coals
once it's charred on one side I'm just
gonna flip it over except for the garlic
and the onion I'm just gonna leave those
where they are those don't need to be
flipped through don't let your jalapeno
is fall through you'd miss one be sad
I'm probably about one more minute you
want to grill the vegetables until
they're charred on both sides and tender
and this is cool enough to chop you can
just put everything back in the same
Bowl you use to mix everything in
there's a little olive oil on the bottom
that's not going to hurt anything you
want to chop the jalapenos more finely
than all your other ingredients and
that's because you want them evenly
dispersed in the salsa if you left him
in big chunks some people would get
jalapeno some people wouldn't I mean the
garlic I'm gonna handle a little
differently I'm going to press it out of
the skin and I'm gonna mash it to a
paste you kind of want to use a chop
chop mash mash action it's a little
chunky a little pasty I know I'm gonna
add half of it to the bowl with the
salsa and the rest I'm gonna save for
the steak and then just finish with the
chopped cilantro and
lime juice it's very good for your hand
strength it is not so good for all those
little cuts on your fingers okay and
then the salsa can just hang out while
you grill the steak I marinated my steak
last night with a little orange juice
some oregano and some chili powder so
that's been sitting absorbing the
flavors and it's ready to go on the
grill right over the coals Oh always
take your meat out of the fridge at
least an hour before you want to grill
it that way it'll come to room
temperature and Grill more evenly the
steaks ready to carve but before I do
that we remember that garlic mash that
we made I'm gonna smear it all over the
meat and that way each slice is going to
have this intense burst of caramelized
garlic now you always want to cut your
meat against the grain and what that
means is that you look for these
striations and you cut perpendicular to
them you don't have to use all the salsa
by the way it keeps really well in the
fridge and you can just use it tomorrow
and it's eggs or maybe make it into
quesadillas it's kind of like you've got
this one pot grilled meal and then you
can use it for several meals okay now
that's all ready for my guests but this
is for the cook
